text: [Music]
hello I'm Daniel a class support
engineer here at the ed ablaze office in
Northern Virginia sometimes customers
asked me how do I enable a SS database
migration service log in and then access
and delete the Amazon CloudWatch logs I
tell them that the login feature is an
important part of the database migration
process using AWS DMS the logs contain
information about the migration process
including errors and warnings for your
task viewing this logs is the only way
to get any granular under-the-hood
information on a migration task that was
started you can enable login using the
AWS CLI API or a SS DMS console for this
video we'll be using the air SS DMS
console let's get started
first let's cover how to enable login as
you can see I already logged into the
AWS management console next navigate to
the a SS DMS console create your tasks
we will now complete the task creation
process note when you hover on the I and
the black circle for each field we'll
see more information about the field
complete all necessary fills however and
the task settings section check the
Enable login checkbox
you can see the task is in a creating
state note you can also do this for an
existing task if the task is running
select the task then select it stop
button when the task changes from the
stopping state to they stopped State
select modify I'm going to go ahead to a
task I created earlier on I will now
stop it
it's now in a stopping state
the task is in a stop state now so I'm
gonna go ahead expand the tax certain
section and check enable login
choose modify
now let's cover how to access cloud
watch logs select the task and then
choose the start regime button the
status would change display in starting
loadcomplete stopped failed and so on if
there are no other tops below the DMS
dashboard unselect and then select the
task again select the logs tab choose
the link enable login this takes you to
the cloud watch window where you can
view the log messages now let's cover
how to delete logs let's go back to the
DMS console choose replication instances
from the navigation pane select the
replication instance that hosts your
tasks choose the log management tab
select the log that you want to delete
choose the delete logs button the delete
logs pop-up window appears with the
information delete the following
permanently this action cannot be undone
select delete also you can delete the
logs from cloud watch go to the cloud
watch window and then select the log
group for your replication instance for
instance a replication instance named
ri1
the log group will be DMS tasks are I 1
select your DMS tasks select the delete
log stream at the deadlock stream pop-up
window appears with the following
message delete the following permanently
this action cannot be undone select YES
delete button
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
you
